Token.Abstract: The class represents a hotpoint mission, which can be executed by the mission manager. User can control the aircraft to fly around the hotpoint with specific radius and altitude. During the execution, user can also using the physical remote controller to modify its radius and speed.
Sets the coordinate of the hot point.
Sets the coordinate of the hot point.
Sets the coordinate of the hot point.
Sets the altitude of the hot point orbit in meters with range [5,120] meters. The altitude is relative to the ground altitude from which the aircraft took off.
Sets the altitude of the hot point orbit in meters with range [5,120] meters. The altitude is relative to the ground altitude from which the aircraft took off.
Sets the altitude of the hot point orbit in meters with range [5,120] meters. The altitude is relative to the ground altitude from which the aircraft took off.
Sets the circular flight path radius the aircraft will fly around the hotpoint. the hot point is. The value of this property should be in range of [DJIHotPointMinRadius, DJIHotPointMaxRadius] meters.
Sets the circular flight path radius the aircraft will fly around the hotpoint. the hot point is. The value of this property should be in range of [DJIHotPointMinRadius, DJIHotPointMaxRadius] meters.
Sets the circular flight path radius the aircraft will fly around the hotpoint. the hot point is. The value of this property should be in range of [DJIHotPointMinRadius, DJIHotPointMaxRadius] meters.
YES if the aircraft is to travel around the hotpoint in the clockwise direction.
YES if the aircraft is to travel around the hotpoint in the clockwise direction.
YES if the aircraft is to travel around the hotpoint in the clockwise direction.

Sets the angular velocity (in degrees/second) of the aircraft as it orbits the hot point. The default value is 20 degrees/s. The angular velocity is relative to the orbit radius. You can use the maxAngularVelocityForRadius:radius method to get the maximum supported angular velocity for a given radius.

Sets the angular velocity (in degrees/second) of the aircraft as it orbits the hot point. The default value is 20 degrees/s. The angular velocity is relative to the orbit radius. You can use the maxAngularVelocityForRadius:radius method to get the maximum supported angular velocity for a given radius.

Sets the angular velocity (in degrees/second) of the aircraft as it orbits the hot point. The default value is 20 degrees/s. The angular velocity is relative to the orbit radius. You can use the maxAngularVelocityForRadius:radius method to get the maximum supported angular velocity for a given radius.
Aircraft's initial point on the circular flight path when starting the hot point mission.
Aircraft's initial point on the circular flight path when starting the hot point mission.
Aircraft's initial point on the circular flight path when starting the hot point mission.
Aircraft's heading while flying around the hot point. It can be pointed towards or away from the hot point, forwards or backwards along its flight route, or be controlled by the remote controller.
Aircraft's heading while flying around the hot point. It can be pointed towards or away from the hot point, forwards or backwards along its flight route, or be controlled by the remote controller.
Aircraft's heading while flying around the hot point. It can be pointed towards or away from the hot point, forwards or backwards along its flight route, or be controlled by the remote controller.
Returns the supported maximum angular velocity in degrees/second for the given hot point radius in meters.

Parameter.Name: radius
Parameter.Abstract: Hot point radius with range [5,500] meters to calculate maximum angular velocity.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Returns the supported maximum angular velocity for the given radius. Will return 0 if an unsupported radius is input.
